data.title: Bash (Windows Subsystem for Linux) - Running without the SUID sandbox!

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise 1607 (OS Build 14393.0) running Windows Linux Subsystem beta

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VS Code 1.7.1 Debian package on Bash on Ubuntu on Windows (`dpkg -i code_1.7.1-1478180561_amd64.deb`)
2. Run code (`code --verbose` shows errors).

```
$ code --verbose
[27:1108/102524:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(231)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/linux_suid_sandbox_development.md for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
[27:1108/102524:FATAL:render_sandbox_host_linux.cc(40)] Check failed: 0 == shutdown(renderer_socket_, SHUT_RD). shutdown: Invalid argument
#0 0x000001e0962e <unknown>
#1 0x000001e1f23b <unknown>
#2 0x000001e1f7fd <unknown>
#3 0x000002892e52 <unknown>
#4 0x00000265e2f9 <unknown>
#5 0x0000026648bf <unknown>
#6 0x00000265d996 <unknown>
#7 0x000001203e97 <unknown>
#8 0x000001202970 <unknown>
#9 0x0000033a9313 main
#10 0x7fd9a7ae1f45 __libc_start_main
#11 0x000000574d79 <unknown>
```

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.title: API Access to "Open Editors"
data.body: I have a use case where I would like to be able to get a list of all the open editors (basically exactly what is shown here). I understand that Editors are disposed but I just need a list of filenames. Something like: `workspace.openDocuments:Array` or even just `workspace.openFiles:Array`. Long term, it might be nice to have API access to operate on this list (EG: sort open editors pane by last opened, name, etc).

data.title: Node debug is not sending a 'thread' event when a new thread gets created
data.body:
Node debug is currently not sending a ['thread' event](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/common/debugProtocol.d.ts#L128) when a new thread gets created. This is problematic for the vscode model since it is not aware of any threads unless a stopped event occurs. This leads to the limitation discussed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15165

fyi @roblourens

data.title: Support snippets in launch configurations
data.body: A debug extension should be able to contribute launch configurations snippets that can be added to a launch.json via Intellisense.

data.title: Repl links fix
data.body:
@isidorn Fixes for #13370 

I got a bunch of errors trying to build VS Code. I will look into this and try to test this later but I wanted to share my commits anyway.

- "root" capture group is now optional to allow relative paths
- "column" capture group is now optional to allow paths without columns (will default to 0)
- colon was added to the path blacklist so the line doesn't get detected as part of the path and the column as line
- optional `file://` prefix was added so the a whole file URI is underlined and not just the path part

data.title: Hover on "this" says undefined, which is wrong
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. See the screenshot, "this" inside my arraow function is "undefined" when I put my cursor on it
![2016-11-08 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8457604/20101710/73dab99c-a5c3-11e6-8fd7-e5a0a7d56ed8.png)

2. In the upper left corner, we can see this: undefined

3. However, if I evalute "this", I get the right "this" in the console (as you can see in the above screenshot)

Why the difference between the "this" when I hover it, and when I evaluate it ?

Regards,
Sylvain

data.title: Debug hover should use scope information
data.body: Improve the hover experience by only showing a hover when inside the scope boundaries.

data.title: 'Type aliases can be used only in a .ts file' error popping up in Flow enabled files
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
1.7.1
- OS Version:
Ubuntu 16

Steps to Reproduce:
Create a .js file and add the following code in it(the file will be processed by Flowtype):
```js
// @flow
type LogActionsType = { type: 'NEW_LOG', payload: Array<Object> } | { type: 'LOGS_PUSHED', payload: null };
export type LogType = Object
```
Whenever I define a type alias the error 'Type aliases can be used only in a .ts file'  keeps showing up and is highlighed in the 'Problems' panel.
Is there any way to disable typescript ? Or prevent this kind of validation of running ?

data.title: JavaScript intellisense with object parameter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Build 14393.351

In JavaScript, does intellisense support object parameter with JSdoc?
In this specific case, I want `foo` parameter inside `Bar.prototype.request` to be treated as `Foo` so that know that it suggests `x`, `y` for me. However, it only shows `any` which means it does not know what type of `foo` is. Will this be available in the future?

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22194121/20099729/afebdd34-a5ec-11e6-8370-2fb9464779cf.png)

data.title: Mac: Double clicking the title bar doesn't maximize the window anymore
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider 2016-11-08T07:53:03.250Z
- OS Version: Mac Sierra

Since today's insider build the window cannot be maximized anymore by double clicking the window's title bar.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open vscode insider build
2. double click the title bar

![double clicking the titlebar](http://i.imgur.com/JTehtY6.jpg)

data.title: Cannot uninstall some extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install _npm Script Runner_ or _HTML Hint_ extension (I did not experience the same problem with other extensions)
2. Uninstall them and click OK to "Are you sure you want to uninstall 'npm Script Runner'"?
3. Restart VSCode

After "successful uninstall", I can see the extension with the "Update" button and then the "Reload" button. I can not remove them via the UI (had to do that via File System instead)

data.title: Debug Pause never makes it to DebugSession
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start debug session
2. Press continue
3. Press pause (event never makes it to DebugSession)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/966863/20097931/f422720e-a5a8-11e6-9b9a-7d57c55d5c14.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/966863/20097952/0e0655dc-a5a9-11e6-8b3e-bca88c713511.png)

As far as I can tell the request never makes it to the ```protocol._handleData```
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/966863/20098058/b2e13676-a5a9-11e6-80bd-6e71cf6ea73b.png)

data.title:
[html] 
 element should be formatted like  in editor, not like 
!
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version:  Windows 7 Ulimate SP1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a `<pre>` element with multiline content
2. Stock VSC HTML formatter will remove line breakes rendering `<pre>` useless. This behavious is not seen in `<code>` element. Obviously a `<pre>` must be auto formatted like `<code>` element. Fix this thing please.

data.title: View can be scrolled so much to present only last line at the top of the view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.3.21|
|MagicPython|magicstack|0.5.15|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|

---

![screen shot 2016-11-08 at 11 33 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2303177/20095821/55960f70-a5a7-11e6-9263-e90aa1a7576a.png)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create file with multiple lines so you can scroll them
2. Scroll to bottom as much as possible.

OBSERVED: See the last line of the file is on the top of the view.
EXPECTED: Scrolling should be prevented when last line of the file meets the bottom of the view.

IMO expected behaviour can be found in many top applications.

data.title: C# Code Folding Stops for Regions After Formatting Document
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a C# file
2. Insert #region and #endregion around a section
3. Code folding works
4. Press Ctrl+Shift+P and Select Format Document (or Shift+Alt+F)
5. #region and #endregion are now indented, code folding no longer works.



![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4262917/20094826/e0a0b960-a59a-11e6-8791-8ea8c52bf983.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4262917/20094876/11714f14-a59b-11e6-95bb-07d84e347218.png)

data.title: Introduce Selection menu
data.body:
In orde to improve discoverability of available editor functionality we introduce a top level "Selection" menu.

- [x] Identify which commands should be in  the menu
- [x] How do we measure the success of the menu
- [x] Implementation

data.title: Address UI scalability concerns in the face of contributeable explorers
data.body:
Allowing custom explorers causes UI scalability concerns that need to be addressed. Among them are
- number if icons in the activity bar
- can the user control what is visible in the activity bar
- discoverability of custom explorers
- scalability of the view menu (should be choose to show custom explorers there)
- relationship to discoverability of panels

data.title: Custom Title: VS Code crashes when closing second tab in fullscreen
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open a VS code window. Make it full screen
2. Open a new VS Code window
3. New window opens a  second tab in full screen mode
4. Close the second window

VS Code crashes

A Title bar is shown for second window which is not there for first window

data.title: Switching breakpoint condition should preserve the condition in breakpoint widget
data.body:
Originaly from @rkeithhill

> For me, the only issue that exists here is that the dropdown UI does not save the current value when switching between Expression and Hit Count. I know the watermark text says to hit press Enter but I think a fair number or folks will type an Expression, hit the drop down to set the Hit Count, then they press Enter. In this scenario only the Hit Count is accepted. The condition expression is not.
